00004 #include"PGBasics.hh"
00005 #include"Sequence.hh"
00006 
00007 #define SEQ_NOISE 10
00008 int Sequence::sequence[] = {0, 1, 2, 1, 2, 3};
00009 int Sequence::seqLen = 6;
00010 
00011 using namespace libpg;
00012 
00013 
00014 // Set up three state model including stochastic trans matricies for each 
00015 Sequence::Sequence() {
00016 
00017     actionDim = ACTION_DIM; // Simple model, 1
00018     obsRows = OBS_DIM;
00019     obsCols = 1;
00020     actions = ACTIONS;
00021     agents = 1;
00022 
00023     reward=0;
00024 }
00025 
00026 
00027 void Sequence::getReward(Vector& rewards) {
00028 
00029     rewards[0] = reward;
00030 
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 
00035 void Sequence::getObservation(Observation& obs) {
00036 
00037     int obsSymbol = sequence[obs.getSteps()%seqLen];
00038     if (random()%SEQ_NOISE == 0) obsSymbol = random()%SYMBOLS;
00039     obs.getFeatures()(0,0) = obsSymbol;
00040 
00041     nextObs = sequence[(obs.getSteps()+1)%seqLen];
00042 
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00046 int Sequence::doAction(Vector& action) {
00047     // Rewards for predicing next observation in sequence
00048     if (action[0] == nextObs) reward=1.0;
00049     else reward=0.0;
00050     return 0;
00051 }

00054 // Maximum episode length in steps. For planning mode. Only used
00055 // by GOALPomdp at the moment.
00056 int Sequence::getMaxEpisodeLength() {
00057     return 0;
00058 }
00059 
00060 // Get the number of rows in observation matrix. Generally the
00061 // length of the observation vector.
00062 int Sequence::getObsRows() {
00063     return obsRows;
00064 }
00065 
00066 // Get the number of columns in the observation matrix Typically
00067 // use multiple columns to provide a different observation to each
00068 // agent, so the number of columns is the same as getAgents()
00069 int Sequence::getObsCols() {
00070     return obsCols;
00071 }
00072 
00073 // Get the total number of agents. Usually 1.
00074 int Sequence::getAgents() {
00075     return agents;
00076 }
00077 
00078 // Get the total action dimensionality. Often, but not
00079 // necessarily, the same as the number of agents.
00080 int Sequence::getActionDim() {
00081     return actionDim;
00082 }
00083 
00084 
00085 // Get the dimensionality of the reward. Typically 1 if there's a single
00086 // Global reward.
00087 int Sequence::getRewardDim() {          
00088     return REWARD_DIM;
00089 }
